page.title: 13CANDY TILES HEATHFIELD
page.content: { Candy Tiles}is a factory on the{ {Heathfield Industrial Estate.}To make the tiles they use{china}and{ball {clay,cobalt,water,whiting}and{slop {flint.}The flint is mined up on Haldon and is made into a liquid slop flint by mixing it with water and pebbles.The china clay comes from Dorset and the ball clay is mined in Cornwall.All the substances are mixed up together in a{blunger.}The mixture is then injected up into a 70ft{spray {dryer}by streams of hot air. After going through the spray dryer the next stage is to check the powder clay for moisture content.Heat in the spray dryer can be altered by a guage. The dried clay is taken by small numbered buckets to the three big {hoppers.}It then is put in buckets to be taken down to the{presses.}There are six presses, each make 180 tiles per hour.
